meanings.definition: A person who revokes or cancels something.
meanings.sent1: The revokers canceled the event at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: The revokers decided to revoke their support for the project.
meanings.sent3: The revokers made a funny dance before canceling the party.
meanings.sent4: The revokers were like erasers, wiping away all the progress.
meanings.sent5: The revokers were like the undo button, reversing all the changes.

meanings.definition: Plural form of revoker, referring to multiple individuals who revoke or cancel something.
meanings.sent1: The team of revokers unanimously agreed to revoke the decision.
meanings.sent2: The revokers gathered to discuss their plan to cancel the contract.
meanings.sent3: The revokers wore matching hats while revoking the agreement.
meanings.sent4: The revokers were a powerful force, nullifying any previous arrangements.
meanings.sent5: The revokers acted like a group of judges, overturning the ruling.
